narrative.title: 164 Leichte Division - 1943Q2
narrative.situation: German Light Infantry Division (Afrika) deployed in North Africa during 1943Q2.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

supply.supply_status: Collapsed - Allied naval and air interdiction cut off sea supply routes from Sicily. Ground supply lines under constant air attack.

weather.seasonal_impacts: Spring rains created mud and limited mobility in April. Drying conditions in May improved trafficability but increased dust clouds revealing positions to Allied aircraft.
weather.environmental_challenges: Rugged terrain limited vehicle mobility. Supply transport extremely difficult on mountain tracks. Allied air superiority prevented daylight movement.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter
